reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Much better than the previous two volumes.
reviews.reviewText: This volume is an actual chapter of character progression, bonding, and growth. The last two volumes focused less on the party, and more on others and Haruhiro-kun. His own party was delegated to "Where are they, ah ok, they are alive. I am weak. Ah, they are alive." Which grinded the story to a cool battle, but a halt to the driving force which is the character bonding.In this volume however it actually had some development, Haruhiro-kun actually finding out what has happened between Merry-san and Kuzaku-san. Shihoru-san actually conversing to Haruhiro-kun and him seeing what they think of him as a leader more. Ranta-san is still the same with some good growth, and Yume is shown as more dependable.The plot is good, nothing that shatters the light novel as a genre, but nobody reading this series should expect that. The change of setting helped with the direction the plot went, and it was a nice change of pace.Overall if you were going to drop this series because the last two volumes were bad, give it a read and see that this volume is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love all of the chapters read so far
reviews.reviewText: I love all of the chapters read so far, this one felt a little repetitive for my liking, since the party was trapped yet in another world, like in the last volume, but there is progression in the character development, there is mystery and wonder. I like how writer Ao describes Haruhiro's inner thoughts, I find the uncertainty familiar to my own thinking, and it brings me joy that other people think like that also, and that others also go through all the psychological stages like happiness, depression, anxiety, will to live, to be someone better that you are, compare oneself to others that have more skill or 'talent', sometimes I feel like Haruhiro and someone is writing a book about me ;) It takes great skill to write such an interesting piece of art and I thank the writer for this joyous time of my life, when I can read and enjoy such a masterpiece.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2019
Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Cannot put this series down. It is a fast and fun read. Slow sometimes when you are in Haru's head too much but that is the only complaint really. Still 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I don't really even know what to say rather than I'm addicted to this beautifully crafted series. Time to read the next volume!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Prefectly captures the feels
reviews.reviewText: I really love this series because it, in my mind, captures what it is to be the average adventurer. No glitz no glamor no glory just humans trying and struggleing and only just getting by with their lives. This volume especially got the palpable near physical feeling of hopelessness of depression and the despair that comes with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2018
reviews.reviewText: Definitely the darkest book of the series (pun intended) it’s interesting to see how the party’s adventure unfolds. I was really excited for this one to end to move on- not in a negative way but in a sense I have hope for something good happening in the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2018
reviews.reviewText: So much world building, character development, and overall just kept me wanting to continue reading to find out the results. I honestly think this volume and onward could be the changing point for haruhiro and his comrades, I truly do! Now onto the next volume haha.
I really liked this realistic and hopeless approach haruhiro gives, it reninds you of the humanity of the character, i can't wait to see the aftermath of the last part.
O grupo vai explorar um novo mundo bastante interessante. Bastante desenvolvimento dos personagens e das relações interpessoais.
Wow this series just impresses me over and over again. Worth the read. Lots and lots of development from the characters.. probably except ranta but oh well it's ranta lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 14, 2019
reviews.reviewText: This volume was, in many ways, in a different world compared to the preceding volumes and the most enjoyable on a deep level. Stuck in a new realm, the story explores the struggles that one can face when being thrown in an alien environment. The need and instinct to adapt to different cultures, languages, customs, currencies...in order to survive and struggle another day. It was so captivating to go through this with the Team Haruhiro. When ultimately given the choice of accepting your new life or fight for your old one, it is a conundrum that was well balanced and explored.This was almost a whole story of its own and one to really remember...
